basics.printMessage: Below, you will find a summary of my professional profile. On my website, you can access more details about my academic background, work experience, personal projects, and how I have applied each of my skills in different contexts.
basics.summary: I am a software developer with experience in designing and implementing scalable and maintainable solutions. I have worked in multidisciplinary teams across various areas of development and possess communication and collaboration skills, which allow me to interact effectively with colleagues and clients. I stand out for my ability to continuously learn, adapt quickly to new challenges, and manage time efficiently in complex projects.

education.institution: Faculty of Mathematics, Astronomy, Physics, and Computer Science (FAMAF)
education.summary: During my university education, I participated in practical projects covering various areas of computer science, working with multiple technologies and paradigms. Some of the most notable experiences include:

Software Development with SCRUM: I collaborated in a multidisciplinary team using #{Jira} and applying !{SCRUM} best practices to ensure agile project management and continuous delivery of value.

We used #{Git} as a version control system, following standard workflows for branch management, code reviews, and collaboration in a shared repository, which enabled efficient continuous integration and conflict-free development.

We developed an &{online board game called 'El Switcher' - https://github.com/orgs/DeMarc-Team/repositories} with #{HTML}, #{CSS}, and #{Tailwind} on the frontend, and #{JavaScript} and #{TypeScript} with #{Vite} and #{ReactJS}, while on the backend we used #{Python} with #{Pydantic}, #{FastAPI}, #{SQLAlchemy}, and for testing, we used #{Jest} for the frontend and #{Pytest} for the backend.
We implemented a !{client-server} architecture with communication based on the !{HTTP} and !{WebSocket} protocols.
Testing and Quality Assurance: I gained experience in testing techniques such as functional, unit, integration, E2E, acceptance, and non-functional testing. I studied !{agile methodologies}, !{TDD}, and !{BDD} to integrate testing from the early stages of development.

I collaborated with developers in software testing, using tools like #{Pytest}, #{Unittest}, #{Mock} (#{Python}), and #{Jest} (#{JavaScript}). I was responsible for documenting tests and analyzing key metrics, such as code coverage and failure rates, to ensure the quality and reliability of the final product.
Databases: I studied the design, optimization, and management of databases, both !{SQL} (#{MySQL}) and !{NoSQL} (#{MongoDB}), focusing on improving query performance and scalability.
Data Analysis and Machine Learning: I performed data analysis using #{Python} and #{Jupyter}, utilizing #{Pandas} for data manipulation and cleaning, and #{NumPy} for performing numerical calculations.
In the field of machine learning, I developed models with #{TensorFlow} and #{PyTorch}, applying !{classification}, !{regression}, and !{neural network} algorithms to solve prediction problems.
Throughout the process, I used #{Seaborn} and #{Matplotlib} to visualize the results.

Distributed Computing: I implemented an automatic article reader using #{Java}, #{Scala}, and #{Apache Spark} for distributed computing and large-scale data analysis.
Network Simulation: I modeled data flow in networks, addressing issues such as flow control, congestion, and performance, using #{C++} and #{OMNeT++} for simulation. I implemented network protocols, optimized performance under high-load conditions, and analyzed network behavior under various traffic scenarios. Additionally, I used visualization tools to interpret simulation results and enhance decision-making in network design.
Concurrency, Process Scheduling, and Res: I replicated a #{Linux} terminal and delved into concurrent and parallel programming, managing threads and processes. I solved issues like race conditions using synchronization tools such as semaphores, mutexes, and barriers to ensure proper execution in concurrent environments.
I investigated process scheduling in the Linux kernel, managing interrupts and optimizing priority allocation through techniques like context switching.
Virtual Microprocessor Simulation: I designed modules for a virtual microprocessor using #{Quartus}, #{SystemVerilog}, and #{Assembler}, gaining an in-depth understanding of processor architecture.
Functional Programming: I learned functional programming with #{Haskell}, implementing map, filter, reduce, and structures like trees, as well as developing a &{DSL for drawing on the screen - https://cs.famaf.unc.edu.ar/~mpagano/henderson-funcgeo2.pdf}.
Algorithms and Data Structures: I implemented algorithms and structures like the greedy algorithm for graph coloring and data structures like stacks, queues, and sets in #{C}.

work.name: Freelance Trading Indicator Developer
work.summary: I developed custom technical and trading indicators on #{TradingView} using #{Pine Script} for !{international clients}. During the process, I conducted !{interviews} to understand their needs and, when necessary, created !{prototypes} in #{Python} using #{yfinance} to retrieve historical financial data, #{matplotlib} for visualizations, and #{numpy} and #{scipy} for calculations, providing precise solutions tailored to each client.

highlights: Worked directly with clients through Meet and Telegram to gather requirements and feedback.
Successfully developed a wide range of custom indicators based on client requirements.

projects.name: DB ORM Test Library
projects.summary: A #{Python} library designed to be easily extensible to various ORMs and databases. Compatible with #{SQLAlchemy}, #{Django}, and more, it is built for !{high-level testing} and !{debugging}, enabling simple, comprehensive, and accurate analysis of changes between two points in a program's lifecycle within a database representative of a real environment. Its comprehensive approach ensures tests are !{quick to implement}, capable of !{maximizing coverage with less code}, while maintaining a !{secure and centralized design}.

Library testing: The library has been thoroughly tested using #{Pytest}, ensuring reliability and seamless integration with popular testing frameworks.
